attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [vertexCount &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFInt32Label; #IMPLIED] [2,infinity) vertexCount describes how many vertices are used in each individual polyline segment from the Coordinate point values. Coordinate point values are assigned as a block of points to each line by taking vertexCount[n] vertices at a time.
attribute.name: vertexCount

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "geometry"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: LineProperties allows fine control over rendering of lines and edges for peer geometry. Hint: include <component name='Shape' level='2'/>
element.name: LineProperties

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [applied &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether or not LineProperties are applied to associated geometry.
attribute.name: applied

attribute.tooltip: [linetype &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "0"]
attribute.name: linetype

attribute.tooltip: [linewidthScaleFactor &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] (v3.1 or later)
attribute.name: linewidthScaleFactor

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "lineProperties"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: LoadSensor generates events as watchList child nodes are either loaded or fail to load. Changing watchlist child nodes restarts the LoadSensor. Hint: use multiple LoadSensor nodes to track multiple loading nodes individually. Hint: Background is not sensed due to multiple-image ambiguity. Warning: watchList child nodes are not rendered, so normally USE copies of other nodes to sense load status. Hint: use Inline 'load' field to prompt or defer loading. Warning: new X3D node, not supported in VRML97.
element.name: LoadSensor

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables the sensor node.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [timeOut &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0" #IMPLIED] Time in seconds of maximum load duration prior to declaring failure. Default value zero means use browser defaults.
attribute.name: timeOut

attribute.tooltip: [isActive: outputOnly&SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive true/false events are sent when load sensing starts/stops.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [isLoaded &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Notify when all watchList child nodes are loaded, or at least one has failed. Sends true on successfully loading all watchList child nodes. Sends false on timeOut of any watchList child nodes, failure of any watchList child nodes to load, or no local copies available and no network present. Hint: use multiple LoadSensor nodes to track multiple loading nodes individually.
attribute.name: isLoaded

attribute.tooltip: [loadTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] Time of successful load complete, not sent on failure.
attribute.name: loadTime

attribute.tooltip: [progress &outputOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; [0,1.0] #FIXED ""] Sends 0.0 on start and 1.0 on completion. Intermediate values are browser dependent and always increasing (may indicate fraction of bytes, fraction of expected time or another metric). Hint: only 0 and 1 events are guaranteed.
attribute.name: progress

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: LOD (Level Of Detail) uses camera-to-object distance to switch among contained child levels. (Contained nodes are now called 'children' rather than 'level', for consistent naming among all GroupingNodeType nodes.) LOD range values go from near to far (as child geometry gets simpler for better performance). For n range values, you must have n+1 children levels! Only currently selected children level is rendered, but all levels continue to send/receive events. Hint: can add <WorldInfo info='null node'/> as nonrendering final (or initial or intermediate) child. Hint: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Warning: do not include Viewpoint or OrthoViewpoint as a child of LOD or Switch, instead use ViewpointGroup as parent to constrain location proximity where the viewpoint is available to user. Warning: results are undefined if a bindable node (Viewpoint, OrthoViewpoint, NavigationInfo, Fog, Background, TextureBackground) is a contained child of LOD or Switch.
element.name: LOD

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [forceTransitions &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Whether to perform every range-based transition, regardless of browser optimizations that might otherwise occur.
attribute.name: forceTransitions

attribute.tooltip: [center &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Viewpoint distance-measurement offset from origin of local coordinate system, used for LOD node distance calculations.
attribute.name: center

attribute.tooltip: [range &initializeOnlyLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] (0,infinity) Specifies ideal distances at which to switch between levels. Camera-to-object distance transitions for each child level, where range values go from near to far. For n range values, you must have n+1 child levels! Hint: can add <WorldInfo info='null node'/> as nonrendering final (or initial or intermediate) child. Hint: not setting range values indicates that level switching can be optimized automatically based on performance.
attribute.name: range

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size: automatically calculated, can be specified as an optimization or constraint.
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [level_changed &outputOnlyLabel; &SFInt32Label; #FIXED ""] Indicates current level of LOD children when activated.
attribute.name: level_changed

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: Material specifies surface rendering properties for associated geometry nodes Material attributes are used by the VRML lighting equations during rendering. Hint: insert Shape and Appearance nodes before adding material.
element.name: Material

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [diffuseColor &inputOutputLabel; &SFColorLabel; "0.8 0.8 0.8"] [0,1] how much direct, angle-dependent light is reflected from all light sources. Hint: only emissiveColor affects IndexedLineSet, LineSet and PointSet.
attribute.name: diffuseColor

attribute.tooltip: [emissiveColor &inputOutputLabel; &SFColorLabel; "0 0 0"] [0,1] how much glowing light is emitted from this object. Hint: emissiveColors glow even when all lights are off. Hint: reset diffuseColor from default (.8 .8 .8) to (0 0 0) to avoid washout. Hint: only emissiveColor affects IndexedLineSet, LineSet and PointSet. Warning: bright emissiveColor values can wash out other colors and some textures.
attribute.name: emissiveColor

attribute.tooltip: [specularColor &inputOutputLabel; &SFColorLabel; "0 0 0"] [0,1] specular highlights are brightness reflections (example: shiny spots on an apple). Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: specularColor

attribute.tooltip: [shininess &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.2"] [0,1] low values provide soft specular glows, high values provide sharper, smaller highlights. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: shininess

attribute.tooltip: [ambientIntensity &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.2"] [0,1] how much ambient omnidirectional light is reflected from all light sources. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: ambientIntensity

attribute.tooltip: [transparency &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] how "clear" an object is: 1.0 is completely transparent, 0.0 is completely opaque. Interchange profile hint: transparency < .5 opaque, transparency > .5 transparent.
attribute.name: transparency

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "material"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: meta (metadata) provides information about the scene and uses the same definitions as HTML's meta tag. The name and content attributes provide attribute=value pairs. Hint: X3D Abstract specification https://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/core.html#METAStatement Hint: X3D XML Encoding https://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19776-1/V3.2/Part01/concepts.html#Header Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#metaTags
element.name: meta

attribute.tooltip: [name CDATA #IMPLIED] Enter the meta (metadata) attribute name here. Hint: use Dublin Core metadata terms for name/content values. https://www.dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms Hint: if the name attribute is set, the http-equiv attribute should not be set.
attribute.name: name

attribute.tooltip: [content CDATA #REQUIRED] The content attribute provides metadata information relevant to the name attribute provided. The name and content attributes provide attribute=value pairs. Hint: use Dublin Core metadata terms for name/content values. https://www.dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms Hint: alternatively the content attribute can support the http-equiv attribute. Hint: many XML tools substitute XML character references automatically if needed (like & for & ampersand or " for " quotation mark).
attribute.name: content

attribute.tooltip: [lang CDATA #IMPLIED] Language code, as per [IETF BCP47/RFC5646] https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt and described in https://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-http-and-lang Hint: Language Subtag Lookup at http://people.w3.org/rishida/utils/subelements
attribute.name: lang

attribute.tooltip: [dir (ltr|rtl) #IMPLIED] Direction for weak/neutral text (ltr=left-to-right, rtl=right-to-left). See http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/struct/dirlang.html#adef-dir
attribute.name: dir

attribute.tooltip: [http-equiv CDATA #IMPLIED] The http-equiv attribute provides an HTTP header for the value of the content attribute. Example: <meta http-equiv='Expires' content='Tue, 20 Aug 1996 14:25:27 GMT'>. Hint: the http-equiv attribute can be used to simulate an HTTP response header. Hint: if the name attribute is set, the http-equiv attribute should not be set. Hint: see http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/struct/global.html#adef-http-equiv
attribute.name: http-equiv

attribute.tooltip: [scheme CDATA #IMPLIED] The scheme attribute allows authors to provide user agents more context for the correct interpretation of meta data. For example, <<meta scheme="ISBN" name="identifier" content="0-8230-2355-9"> See http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/struct/global.html#idx-scheme
attribute.name: scheme

element.tooltip: MetadataDouble contains a typed list of values providing metadata information about its parent node. Further information about this Metadata node may be provided by a single child Metadata node with containerField="metadata". Hint: use containerField="value" if the parent node is MetadataSet. Hint: IS child element precedes any Metadata node child element, which precedes any other children elements. Hint: The choice of MetadataDouble versus MetadataFloat usually depends on the relevant tool utilizing the value, or else the relevant metadata reference defining the value. Hint: https://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter15-Metadata/Chapter15-MetadataInformation.html
element.name: MetadataDouble

element.tooltip: MovieTexture applies a 2D movie image to surface geometry, or provides audio for a Sound node. First define as texture, then USE as Sound source to see it/hear it/save memory. Texture maps have a 2D coordinate system (s, t) horizontal and vertical, with (s, t) values in range [0.0, 1.0] for opposite corners of the image. Hint: insert Shape and Appearance nodes before adding texture. Hint: provide a Viewpoint that allows a clear view of the MovieTexture so that users can easily see all details. Hint: utilize DEF/USE references for multiple copies of a single MovieTexture video file in order to avoid multiple-download delays, reduce memory requirements, and maintain synchronization. Hint: support for MPEG-1 video format is required, other formats are optional. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Images
element.name: MovieTexture

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [url &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Location and filename of movie file or stream. Multiple locations are more reliable, and including a Web address lets e-mail attachments work. Hint: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so separate each individual string by quote marks [ "http://www.url1.org" "http://www.url2.org" "etc." ]. Hint: XML encoding for " is " (a character entity). Warning: strictly match directory and filename capitalization for http links! Hint: can replace embedded blank(s) in url queries with %20 for each blank character. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#urls
attribute.name: url

attribute.tooltip: [loop &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Repeat indefinitely when loop=true, repeat only once when loop=false.
attribute.name: loop

attribute.tooltip: [speed &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1.0"] Factor for how fast the movie (or soundtrack) is played. Hint: a negative speed value sets the movie to play in reverse.
attribute.name: speed

attribute.tooltip: [startTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value.
attribute.name: startTime

attribute.tooltip: [stopTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value.
attribute.name: stopTime

attribute.tooltip: [repeatS &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether to horizontally repeat texture along S axis.
attribute.name: repeatS

attribute.tooltip: [repeatT &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether to vertically repeat texture along T axis.
attribute.name: repeatT

attribute.tooltip: [duration_changed &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] Length of time in seconds for one cycle of movie.
attribute.name: duration_changed

attribute.tooltip: [isActive: outputOnly SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive true/false events are sent when playback starts/stops.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [isPaused &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isPaused true/false events are sent when MovieTexture is paused/resumed. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: isPaused

attribute.tooltip: [pauseTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] When time now >= pauseTime, isPaused becomes true and MovieTexture becomes paused. Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: pauseTime

attribute.tooltip: [resumeTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] When resumeTime becomes <= time now, isPaused becomes false and MovieTexture becomes active. Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: resumeTime

attribute.tooltip: [elapsedTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] Current elapsed time since MovieTexture activated/running, cumulative in seconds, and not counting any paused time. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: elapsedTime

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "texture"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: MultiTexture applies several individual textures to a 3D object to achieve a more complex visual effect. MultiTexture contains multiple ImageTexture, MovieTexture and PixelTexture nodes. Texture maps have a 2D coordinate system (s, t) horizontal and vertical, with (s, t) values in range [0.0, 1.0] for opposite corners of the image. Hint: insert Shape and Appearance nodes before adding texture.
element.name: MultiTexture

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [alpha &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1.0"] [0,1] The alpha field defines the alpha (1-transparency) base value for mode operations.
attribute.name: alpha

attribute.tooltip: [color &inputOutputLabel; &SFColorLabel; "1 1 1"] [0,1] The color field defines the RGB base values for mode operations.
attribute.name: color

attribute.tooltip: [function &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &MultiTextureFunctionValues; #IMPLIED] function operators COMPLEMENT or ALPHAREPLICATE can be applied after the mode blending operation. Empty string value "" indicates that no function operation is applied for that stage.
attribute.name: function

attribute.tooltip: [mode &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; &MultiTextureModes; #IMPLIED] mode field indicates the type of blending operation, both for color and for alpha channel.
attribute.name: mode

attribute.tooltip: [source &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; &MultiTextureSourceValues; #IMPLIED] source field determines whether each image source is treated as DIFFUSE, SPECULAR or a multiplicative FACTOR. Empty string value "" indicates that no source modifier is applied for that stage.
attribute.name: source

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "texture"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: MultiTextureCoordinate contains multiple TextureCoordinate or TextureCoordinateGenerator nodes, for use by a parent polygonal geometry node such as IndexedFaceSet or a Triangle* node. Each of the contained texture coordinate nodes correspond to the multiple texture nodes contained in a sibling Appearance/MultiTexture node. Hint: add Shape and then polgyonal/planar geometry before adding MultiTextureCoordinate.
element.name: MultiTextureCoordinate

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "texCoord"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: MultiTextureTransform contains multiple TextureTransform nodes, for use by sibling ImageTexture MovieTexture or PixelTexture nodes. Hint: insert Shape and Appearance nodes before adding TextureTransform.
element.name: MultiTextureTransform

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "textureTransform"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: NavigationInfo describes the user's viewing model, user navigation-interaction modalities, and also dimensional characteristics of the user's (typically invisible) avatar. Hint: for inspection of simple objects, usability often improves with type="EXAMINE" "ANY" Hint: NavigationInfo types '"WALK" "FLY"' support camera-to-object collision detection. Hint: Background, Fog, NavigationInfo, TextureBackground and Viewpoint are bindable nodes, meaning that no more than one of each node type can be active at a given time. Warning: results are undefined if a bindable node (Viewpoint, OrthoViewpoint, NavigationInfo, Fog, Background, TextureBackground) is a contained child of LOD or Switch. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Viewpoints
element.name: NavigationInfo

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [type &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; "EXAMINE" "ANY"] Enter one or more quoted SFString values: "EXAMINE" "WALK" "FLY" "LOOKAT" "EXPLORE" "ANY" "NONE". Hint: for inspection of simple objects, usability often improves with type="EXAMINE" "ANY". Hint: types WALK and FLY force strict camera-to-object collision detection. Hint: see Collision node for further details on camera-to-object collision detection. Hint: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so separate each individual string by quote marks [ "http://www.url1.org" "http://www.url2.org" "etc." ] Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: type

attribute.tooltip: [speed &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1.0"] [0,+infinity) Default rate at which viewer travels through scene, meters/second. Warning: default 1 m/s usually seems slow for ordinary navigation. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: speed

attribute.tooltip: [headlight &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enable/disable directional light that always points in the direction the user is looking.
attribute.name: headlight

attribute.tooltip: [avatarSize &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; "0.25 1.6 0.75"] avatarSize triplet values are: (a) collision distance between user and geometry (near culling plane of the view frustrum) (b) viewer height above terrain (c) tallest height viewer can WALK over. Hint: keep (visibilityLimit / avatarSize.CollisionDistance) < 10,000 to avoid aliasing artifacts (i.e. polygon "tearing"). Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: avatarSize

attribute.tooltip: [visibilityLimit &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.0"] Geometry beyond the visibilityLimit may not be rendered (far culling plane of the view frustrum). visibilityLimit=0.0 indicates an infinite visibility limit. Hint: keep visibilityLimit >= zero. Hint: keep (visibilityLimit / avatarSize.CollisionDistance) < 10,000 to avoid aliasing artifacts (i.e. polygon "tearing"). Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: visibilityLimit

attribute.tooltip: [transitionType &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; "LINEAR"] Camera transition between viewpoints. Enter one or more quoted SFString values: "ANIMATE" "TELEPORT" "LINEAR". Hint: "ANIMATE" behavior is browser-specific, "TELEPORT" is immediate, and "LINEAR" may proceed directly through intervening objects.
attribute.name: transitionType

attribute.tooltip: [transitionTime &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; "1.0"] (v3.1 or later) Duration of viewpoint transition in seconds. Hint: If transitionType is "ANIMATE", transitionTime provides browser-dependent animation parameters. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: transitionTime

attribute.tooltip: [transitionComplete &outputOnlyLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #FIXED ""] Event signaling viewpoint transition complete. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: transitionComplete

attribute.tooltip: [set_bind &inputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Setting set_bind true makes this node active setting set_bind false makes this node inactive. Thus setting set_bind true/false will pop/push (enable/disable) this node.
attribute.name: set_bind

attribute.tooltip: [bindTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] Event sent when node becomes active/inactive.
attribute.name: bindTime

attribute.tooltip: [isBound &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Event true sent when node becomes active, event false sent when unbound by another node.
attribute.name: isBound

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: Normal is a set of 3D surface-normal vectors Normal values are perpendicular directions that are used per-polygon or per-vertex when computing lighting and shading.

element.name: NormalInterpolator

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions

element.tooltip: PixelTexture creates a 2D-image texture map using a numeric array of pixel values. Texture maps have a 2D coordinate system (s, t) horizontal and vertical, with (s, t) values in range [0.0, 1.0] for opposite corners of the image. Hint: this is a good way to bundle image(s) into a single scene file, avoiding multiple downloads. Warning: aggregate file size can grow dramatically. Hint: insert Shape and Appearance nodes before adding texture. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Images
element.name: PixelTexture

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions

Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [image &inputOutputLabel; &SFImageLabel; "0 0 0"] Defines image: width, height, number_of_components per each pixel value, and list of pixel_values. Note that width and height are pixel count, and allowed values for RGBA number_of_components in each pixel value are 1 (intensity), 2 (intensity alpha), 3 (red green blue), 4 (red green blue alpha-opacity). Warning: the order of initial values in PixelTexture and PixelTexture3D image arrays are different. Example: intensity [1 2 1 0xFF 0x00] Example: intensity-alpha [2 2 1 0 255 255 0] Example: red-green-blue [2 4 3 0xFF0000 0xFF00 0 0 0 0 0xFFFFFF 0xFFFF00] Example: red-green-blue-alpha [2 2 4 0xFFFFFFAA 0xFFFF00AA 0x11111111AA 0x787800AA]
attribute.name: image

attribute.tooltip: [repeatS &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether to horizontally repeat texture along S axis.
attribute.name: repeatS

attribute.tooltip: [repeatT &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether to vertically repeat texture along T axis.
attribute.name: repeatT

element.tooltip: PlaneSensor converts pointing device motion into 2D translation parallel to the local Z=0 plane. Hint: create a LineSensor by constraining one axis: (minPosition.x=maxPosition.x) or (minPosition.y=maxPosition.y). Hint: Sensors are affected by peer nodes and children of peers. Hint: add transparent geometry to see the effect of the sensor.
element.name: PlaneSensor

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions

Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [description &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Text tooltip description to be displayed for action of this node. Hint: use spaces, make descriptions clear and readable. Hint: many XML tools substitute XML character references automatically if needed (like & for & or " for " ).
attribute.name: description

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables the sensor node.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [minPosition &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; "0 0"] minPosition and maxPosition clamp translations to a range of values measured from origin of Z=0 plane default maxPosition < minPosition means no clamping. Hint: create a LineSensor by constraining one axis (minPosition.x=maxPosition.x) or (minPosition.y=maxPosition.y).
attribute.name: minPosition

attribute.tooltip: [maxPosition &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; "-1 -1"] minPosition and maxPosition clamp translations to a range of values measured from origin of Z=0 plane default maxPosition < minPosition means no clamping. Hint: create a LineSensor by constraining one axis (minPosition.x=maxPosition.x) or (minPosition.y=maxPosition.y).
attribute.name: maxPosition

attribute.tooltip: [autoOffset &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Determines whether previous offset values are remembered/accumulated.
attribute.name: autoOffset

attribute.tooltip: [offset &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Sends event and remembers last value sensed.
attribute.name: offset

attribute.tooltip: [trackPoint_changed &outputOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] trackPoint_changed events give intersection point of bearing with sensor's virtual geometry.
attribute.name: trackPoint_changed

attribute.tooltip: [translation_changed &outputOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; #FIXED ""] translation_changed events equal sum of relative translation change plus offset value.
attribute.name: translation_changed

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive true/false events are sent when triggering the sensor. isActive=true when primary mouse button is pressed, isActive=false when released.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [isOver &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] is pointing device over sensor's geometry?
attribute.name: isOver

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: PointLight is a single light source that illuminates outwards in all directions Light illuminates all geometry and is normally scoped to illuminate peers and children nodes within the scene graph hierarchy Lights have no visible shape themselves and shine through occluding geometry. Hint: HeadLight enabled on/off is controlled by NavigationInfo.
element.name: PointLight

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [on &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables this light source.
attribute.name: on

attribute.tooltip: [color &inputOutputLabel; &SFColorLabel; "1 1 1"] [0,1] color of light, applied to colors of objects.
attribute.name: color

attribute.tooltip: [location &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Position of light relative to local coordinate system.
attribute.name: location

attribute.tooltip: [intensity &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1"] [0,1] Brightness of direct emission from the light.
attribute.name: intensity

attribute.tooltip: [ambientIntensity &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] Brightness of ambient (nondirectional background) emission from the light.
attribute.name: ambientIntensity

attribute.tooltip: [radius &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "100"] Maximum effective distance of light relative to local light position, affected by ancestor scaling.
attribute.name: radius

attribute.tooltip: [attenuation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "1 0 0"] Constant, linear-distance and squared-distance dropoff factors.
attribute.name: attenuation

attribute.tooltip: [global &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] (v3.1 or later) Global lights illuminate all objects within their volume of lighting influence. Scoped lights only illuminate objects within the same transformation hierarchy.
attribute.name: global

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: PointSet is a node that contains a set of colored 3D points, represented by contained Color/ColorRGBA and Coordinate/CoordinateDouble nodes. Color values or a sibling Material emissiveColor is used to draw lines and points. Hint: use a different color (or emissiveColor) than the background color. Hint: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Hint: you can also substitute a type-matched ProtoInstance node for contained content.
element.name: PointSet

element.tooltip: ProtoDeclare is a Prototype Declaration, defining a new node made up of other node(s). ProtoDeclare contains ProtoInterface and ProtoBody elements. Hint: ProtoInterface contains field interfaces using the <field> tag, then ProtoBody contains the X3D nodes making up this prototype. Hint: initial scene node in a ProtoDeclare body determines this prototype's node type. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#InlinesPrototypes

attribute.name: appinfo

attribute.tooltip: [documentation &SFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Documentation url for further information, similar to XML Schema documentation tag.
attribute.name: documentation

element.tooltip: ProtoInterface is the first element inside ProtoDeclare and holds field definitions.
element.name: ProtoInterface

element.tooltip: ProtoBody collects ProtoDeclare body nodes. Warning: only the first top-level node and its children are rendered, subsequent nodes (such as Scripts and ROUTEs) will be active but will not be drawn.
element.name: ProtoBody

element.tooltip: ProtoInstance creates an instance of a locally or externally declared prototype node. Hint: override default initializations of field values using <fieldValue> elements. Warning: the local context of this ProtoInstance must match the node type of the first node in the original ProtoDeclare declaration. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#InlinesPrototypes
element.name: ProtoInstance

attribute.tooltip: [name NMTOKEN #REQUIRED] name of the prototype node being instanced. Hint: must match name of corresponding ProtoDeclare or ExternProtoDeclare in this scene.

element.tooltip: Scene is the root node that contains an X3D scene graph. Add nodes and children to build a scene. Only one Scene root node is allowed per file. Hint: Scene fields expose the functionality of the Script node's Browser class. Note: Scene nodes within Inlined worlds report identical values as top-most root Scene node. Warning: browser support for fields in this node is partial/experimental.
element.name: Scene

element.tooltip: Script provides programmed behavior for a scene. Define the script interface with <field> elements. Scripting code is embedded in a child CDATA node or (deprecated) in the url field. Optionally supported languages: ECMAScript/JavaScript and (via url to a myNode.class file) Java.
element.name: Script

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: DEF name is needed or else ROUTEs cannot connect Script node interfaces. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [url &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] points to a script file or contains scripting code preferred alternative to url scripts: insert a CDATA node to contain embedded source code CDATA can protect literals like < and > from syntax checkers. Hint: ECMAScript is the same as JavaScript. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#urls
attribute.name: url

attribute.tooltip: [directOutput &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Set directOutput true if Script has field reference(s) of type SFNode/MFNode, and also uses direct access to modify attributes of a referenced node in the Scene. Hint: set directOutput true if Script dynamically establishes or breaks ROUTEs. Hint: directOutput is a browser hint to avoid overoptimizing referenced nodes, since the Script may change their attribute values without ROUTEd events. Hint: directOutput false means Script cannot modify referenced nodes or change ROUTEs.
attribute.name: directOutput

attribute.tooltip: [mustEvaluate &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] If mustEvaluate false, then browser may delay sending input events to Script until outputs are needed. If mustEvaluate true, then Script must receive input events immediately without browser delays. Hint: set mustEvaluate true when sending/receiving values via the network.
attribute.name: mustEvaluate

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: Shape can appear under any grouping node. Shape can contain an Appearance node and a geometry node (Box Cone Cylinder ElevationGrid Extrusion IndexedFaceSet IndexedLineSet LineSet PointSet Sphere Text). Hint: you can also substitute a type-matched ProtoInstance node for contained content.

element.tooltip: The Sound node controls the 3D spatialization of sound playback by a child AudioClip or MovieTexture node. Sound intensity includes stereo support, varying according to user location and view direction in the scene. Hint: if the audio source is stereo or multi-channel, channel separation is retained during playback. Warning: while providing sounds on the ground plane, ensure that the audible auralization ellipse is sufficiently elevated to match avatar height. Hint: X3D Scene Authoring Hints https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#Audio
element.name: Sound

attribute.tooltip: [direction &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 1"] direction of sound axis, relative to local coordinate system.
attribute.name: direction

attribute.tooltip: [intensity &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1"] Factor [0,1] adjusting loudness (decibels) of emitted sound.
attribute.name: intensity

attribute.tooltip: [minFront &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1"] Inner (full volume) ellipsoid distance along front direction. Ensure minFront <= maxFront.
attribute.name: minFront

attribute.tooltip: [minBack &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1"] Inner (full volume) ellipsoid distance along back direction. Ensure minBack <= maxBack.
attribute.name: minBack

attribute.tooltip: [maxFront &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "10"] Outer (zero volume) ellipsoid distance along front direction. Ensure minFront <= maxFront.
attribute.name: maxFront

attribute.tooltip: [maxBack &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "10"] Outer (zero volume) ellipsoid distance along back direction. Ensure minBack <= maxBack.
attribute.name: maxBack

attribute.tooltip: [priority &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] Player hint [0,1] if needed to choose which sounds to play.
attribute.name: priority

attribute.tooltip: [spatialize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Whether to spatialize sound playback relative to viewer. Hint: only effective between minimum and maximum ellipsoids.

attribute.tooltip: [solid &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Setting solid true means draw only one side of polygons (backface culling on), setting solid false means draw both sides of polygons (backface culling off). Warning: default value true can completely hide geometry if viewed from wrong side! Hint: if in doubt, use solid='false' for maximum visibility. Warning: solid false not supported in VRML97.

element.tooltip: SphereSensor converts pointing device motion into a spherical rotation about the origin of the local coordinate system. Hint: Sensors are affected by peer nodes and children of peers. Hint: add transparent geometry to see the effect of the sensor.

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables the sensor node.

attribute.tooltip: [autoOffset &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Determines whether previous offset values are remembered/accumulated.

attribute.tooltip: [offset &inputOutputLabel; &SFRotationLabel; "0 1 0 0"] Sends event and remembers last value sensed.

element.tooltip: SpotLight is a light source that illuminates geometry within a conical beam. Light illuminates all geometry and is normally scoped to illuminate peers and children nodes within the scene graph hierarchy Lights have no visible shape themselves and shine through occluding geometry. Hint: HeadLight enabled on/off is controlled by NavigationInfo.
element.name: SpotLight

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [on &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables this light source.
attribute.name: on

attribute.tooltip: [color &inputOutputLabel; &SFColorLabel; "1 1 1"] [0,1] color of light, applied to colors of objects.
attribute.name: color

attribute.tooltip: [location &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Position of light relative to local coordinate system.
attribute.name: location

attribute.tooltip: [direction &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 -1"] Orientation vector of light relative to local coordinate system.
attribute.name: direction

attribute.tooltip: [intensity &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1"] [0,1] Brightness of direct emission from the light.
attribute.name: intensity

attribute.tooltip: [ambientIntensity &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] [0,1] Brightness of ambient (nondirectional background) emission from the light.
attribute.name: ambientIntensity

attribute.tooltip: [attenuation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "1 0 0"] Constant, linear-distance and squared-distance dropoff factors.
attribute.name: attenuation

attribute.tooltip: [radius &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "100"] Maximum effective distance of light relative to local light position, affected by ancestor scaling.
attribute.name: radius

attribute.tooltip:
[beamWidth &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.7854"] [0,1.570796] Inner conical solid angle (in radians) where light source has uniform full intensity.
Hint: beamWidth is inner angle of full intensity, cutOffAngle is outer angle of zero intensity. Therefore set beamWidth <= cutOffAngle. Warning: if beamWidth > cutOffAngle, then beamWidth reset to equal cutOffAngle.
attribute.name: beamWidth

attribute.tooltip:
[cutOffAngle &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "1.570796"] [0,1.570796] Outer conical solid angle (in radians) where light source intensity becomes zero.
Hint: beamWidth is inner angle of full intensity, cutOffAngle is outer angle of zero intensity. Therefore set beamWidth <= cutOffAngle. Warning: if beamWidth > cutOffAngle, then beamWidth reset to equal cutOffAngle.
attribute.name: cutOffAngle

attribute.tooltip: [global &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] (v3.1 or later) Global lights illuminate all objects within their volume of lighting influence. Scoped lights only illuminate objects within the same transformation hierarchy.
attribute.name: global

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: StaticGroup is a Grouping node that can contain most nodes. StaticGroup children are guaranteed to not change, send events, receive events, or include re-USE-able content. This allows browser optimizations of contained-node content. Hint: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Hint: include <component name='Grouping' level='3'/>
element.name: StaticGroup

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [bboxSize &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "-1 -1 -1"] Bounding box size: automatically calculated, can be specified as an optimization or constraint.
attribute.name: bboxSize

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: StringSensor generates events as the user presses keys on the keyboard.
element.name: StringSensor

attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables the sensor node.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [deletionAllowed &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] If deletionAllowed is true, then previously entered character in enteredText can be removed. If deletionAllowed is false, then characters may only be added to the string. Hint: deletion key is typically defined by local system.
attribute.name: deletionAllowed

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive true/false events are sent when triggering the sensor. isActive=true when primary mouse button is pressed, isActive=false when released.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [enteredText &outputOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; #FIXED ""] Events generated as character-producing keys are pressed on keyboard.
attribute.name: enteredText

attribute.tooltip: [finalText &outputOnlyLabel; &SFStringLabel; #FIXED ""] Events generated when sequence of keystrokes matches keys in terminationText string when this condition occurs, enteredText is moved to finalText and enteredText is set to empty string. Hint: termination key is typically defined by local system.
attribute.name: finalText

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: Switch is a Grouping node that only renders one (or zero) child at a time. Switch can contain most nodes. (Contained nodes are now called 'children' rather than 'choice', for consistent naming among all GroupingNodeType nodes.) All child choices continue to receive & send events regardless of whichChoice is active. Hint: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Hint: authors can temporarily hide test geometry under an unselected child of a Switch. This is a good alternative to "commenting out" nodes. Warning: do not include Viewpoint or OrthoViewpoint as a child of LOD or Switch, instead use ViewpointGroup as parent to constrain location proximity where the viewpoint is available to user. Warning: results are undefined if a bindable node (Viewpoint, OrthoViewpoint, NavigationInfo, Fog, Background, TextureBackground) is a contained child of LOD or Switch.
element.name: Switch

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [whichChoice &inputOutputLabel; &SFInt32Label; "-1"] Index of active child choice, counting from 0. Warning: default whichChoice= -1 means no selection (and no rendering), whichChoice=0 means initial child.
attribute.name: whichChoice

attribute.tooltip: [bboxCenter &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFVec3fLabel; "0 0 0"] Bounding box center: position offset from origin of local coordinate system.
attribute.name: bboxCenter

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: Text is a geometry node that can contain a FontStyle node. Hint: insert a Shape node before adding geometry or Appearance. Hint: you can also substitute a type-matched ProtoInstance node for contained content.
element.name: Text

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [string &inputOutputLabel; &MFStringLabel; #IMPLIED] Single or multiple string values to present as Text. Hint: MFString arrays can have multiple values, so separate each individual string by quote marks Hint: Strings can contain quote marks by first escaping them with a backslash example: "say \"hello\" please" Hint: many XML tools substitute XML character references automatically if needed (like & for & ampersand or " for " quotation mark).
attribute.name: string

attribute.tooltip: [length &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] Array of length values for each text string in the local coordinate system. Each string is stretched or compressed to fit.
attribute.name: length

attribute.tooltip: [maxExtent &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0.0"] Limits/compresses all text strings if max string length is longer than maxExtent, as measured in local coordinate system.
attribute.name: maxExtent

attribute.tooltip: [solid &initializeOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Setting solid true means draw only one side of polygons (backface culling on), setting solid false means draw both sides of polygons (backface culling off). Warning: default value true can completely hide geometry if viewed from wrong side! Hint: if in doubt, use solid='false' for maximum visibility. Warning: solid false not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: solid

attribute.tooltip: [lineBounds &outputOnlyLabel; &MFVec2fLabel; #IMPLIED] Array of 2D bounding box values for each line of text in the local coordinate system.
attribute.name: lineBounds

attribute.tooltip: [textBounds &outputOnlyLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; #IMPLIED] 2D bounding box value for all lines of text in the local coordinate system.
attribute.name: textBounds

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "geometry"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: TextureBackground simulates ground and sky, using vertical arrays of wraparound color values, TextureBackground can also provide backdrop texture images on all six sides. Field names of child texture nodes are in alphabetic order: backTexture, bottomTexture, frontTexture, leftTexture, rightTexture, topTexture. Hint: Background, Fog, NavigationInfo, TextureBackground and Viewpoint are bindable nodes, meaning that no more than one of each node type can be active at a given time. Warning: results are undefined if a bindable node (Viewpoint, OrthoViewpoint, NavigationInfo, Fog, Background, TextureBackground) is a contained child of LOD or Switch.
element.name: TextureBackground

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [skyColor &inputOutputLabel; &MFColorLabel; "0 0 0"] Color of the sky at various angles on the sky sphere. First value is color of sky at 0.0 radians representing the zenith (straight up). Warning: you must have one more skyColor value than skyAngle values. Interchange profile hint: only one color might be rendered, others can be ignored.
attribute.name: skyColor

attribute.tooltip: [skyAngle &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] [0,π] The angle values increase from 0.0 zenith (straight up) to π/2=1.570796 (horizon) to π=3.14159 (nadir). Warning: you must have one more skyColor value than skyAngle values. Warning: colors at skyAngle=0 are ignored. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: skyAngle

attribute.tooltip: [groundColor &inputOutputLabel; &MFColorLabel; #IMPLIED] Color of the ground at the various angles on the ground partial sphere. First value is color of ground at 0.0 radians representing the nadir (straight down). Warning: you must have one more groundColor value than groundAngle values. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: groundColor

attribute.tooltip: [groundAngle &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; #IMPLIED] [0,π/2] The angle values increase from 0.0 nadir (straight down) to π/2=1.570796 (horizon). Warning: you must have one more groundColor value than groundAngle values. Warning: colors at groundAngle=0 are ignored. Interchange profile hint: this field may be ignored.
attribute.name: groundAngle

attribute.tooltip: [transparency &inputOutputLabel; &MFFloatLabel; "0"] transparency applied to texture images, enabling X3D scene to overlay an HTML page or desktop.
attribute.name: transparency

attribute.tooltip: [set_bind &inputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] Input event set_bind=true makes this node active, input event set_bind=false makes this node inactive. Thus setting set_bind true/false will pop/push (enable/disable) this node.
attribute.name: set_bind

attribute.tooltip: [bindTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] event sent when node becomes active/inactive.
attribute.name: bindTime

attribute.tooltip: [isBound &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] event true sent when node becomes active, event false sent when unbound by another node.
attribute.name: isBound

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: TextureCoordinate specifies 2D (s,t) texture-coordinate points, used by vertex-based geometry nodes (such as IndexedFaceSet or ElevationGrid) to map textures to vertices (and patches to polygons). Hint: add Shape and then polgyonal/planar geometry before adding TextureCoordinate.

Hint: add Shape and then polgyonal/planar geometry before adding TextureCoordinateGenerator.

attribute.tooltip: [mode &inputOutputLabel; &SFStringLabel; &TextureCoordinateGeneratorModes; SPHERE] parameter field defines the algorithm used to compute texture coordinates. Warning: do not wrap quotation marks around this SFString enumeration value. Hint: see Table 18.6 Texture coordinate generation modes https://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/texturing.html#t-Texturecoordgeneration for further details.
attribute.name: mode

attribute.tooltip: [parameter &inputOutputLabel; &MFVec2fLabel; #IMPLIED] float values for modes NOISE (for scale and translation x y z values), SPHERE-REFLECT (for optional index of refraction value) and SPHERE-REFLECT-LOCAL (for index of refraction value and x y z eye-point values in local coordinate system)
attribute.name: parameter

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: TextureTransform shifts 2D texture coordinates to position, orient and scale image patches. Warning: resulting visible effects appear reversed because image changes occur before mapping to geometry. Hint: order of operations is translation, rotation about center, non-uniform scale about center. Hint: insert Shape and Appearance nodes before adding TextureTransform.
element.name: TextureTransform

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.

attribute.tooltip: [translation &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; "0 0"] Lateral/vertical shift in 2D (s,t) texture coordinates (opposite effect appears on geometry).
attribute.name: translation

attribute.tooltip: [center &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; "0 0"] center point in 2D (s,t) texture coordinates for rotation and scaling.
attribute.name: center

attribute.tooltip: [rotation &inputOutputLabel; &SFFloatLabel; "0"] single rotation angle of texture about center (opposite effect appears on geometry). Warning: use a single radian angle value, not a 4-tuple Rotation.
attribute.name: rotation

attribute.tooltip: [scale &inputOutputLabel; &SFVec2fLabel; "1 1"] Non-uniform planar scaling of texture about center (opposite effect appears on geometry).
attribute.name: scale

attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: TimeSensor continuously generates events as time passes. Typical use: ROUTE thisTimeSensor.fraction_changed TO someInterpolator.set_fraction. Interchange profile hint: TimeSensor may be ignored if cycleInterval < 0.01 second. Hint: event timing details are explained in 4.4.8.3 Execution model https://www.web3d.org/files/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/concepts.html#ExecutionModel
element.name: TimeSensor

attribute.tooltip: [DEF ID #IMPLIED] DEF defines a unique ID name for this node, referenceable by other nodes. Hint: descriptive DEF names improve clarity and help document a model. Hint: https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dSceneAuthoringHints.html#NamingConventions
attribute.name: DEF

attribute.tooltip: [USE IDREF #IMPLIED] USE means reuse an already DEF-ed node ID, excluding all child nodes and all other attributes (except for containerField, which can have a different value). Hint: USEing other geometry (instead of duplicating nodes) can improve performance. Warning: do NOT include any child nodes, a DEF attribute, or any other attribute values (except for containerField) when defining a USE attribute. Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
attribute.name: USE

attribute.tooltip: [enabled &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "true"] Enables/disables the sensor node.
attribute.name: enabled

attribute.tooltip: [cycleInterval &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "1.0"] cycleInterval is loop duration in seconds. Interchange profile hint: TimeSensor may be ignored if cycleInterval < 0.01 second.
attribute.name: cycleInterval

attribute.tooltip: [loop &inputOutputLabel; &SFBoolLabel; "false"] Repeat indefinitely when loop=true, repeat only once when loop=false.
attribute.name: loop

attribute.tooltip: [startTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] When time now >= startTime, isActive becomes true and TimeSensor becomes active. Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value.
attribute.name: startTime

attribute.tooltip: [stopTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] When stopTime becomes <= time now, isActive becomes false and TimeSensor becomes inactive. Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value.
attribute.name: stopTime

attribute.tooltip: [cycleTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] cycleTime sends a time outputOnly at startTime, and also at the beginning of each new cycle (useful for synchronization with other time-based objects).
attribute.name: cycleTime

attribute.tooltip: [isActive &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isActive true/false events are sent when TimeSensor starts/stops running.
attribute.name: isActive

attribute.tooltip: [isPaused &outputOnlyLabel; &SFBoolLabel; #FIXED ""] isPaused true/false events are sent when TimeSensor is paused/resumed. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: isPaused

attribute.tooltip: [pauseTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] When time now >= pauseTime, isPaused becomes true and TimeSensor becomes paused. Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: pauseTime

attribute.tooltip: [resumeTime &inputOutputLabel; &SFTimeLabel; "0"] When resumeTime becomes <= time now, isPaused becomes false and TimeSensor becomes inactive. Absolute time: number of seconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT. Hint: usually receives a ROUTEd time value. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: resumeTime

attribute.tooltip: [elapsedTime &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] Current elapsed time since TimeSensor activated/running, cumulative in seconds, and not counting any paused time. Warning: not supported in VRML97.
attribute.name: elapsedTime

attribute.tooltip: [fraction_changed &outputOnlyLabel; &SFFloatLabel; #FIXED ""] fraction_changed continuously sends value in range [0,1] showing time progress in the current cycle.
attribute.name: fraction_changed

attribute.tooltip: [time &outputOnlyLabel; &SFTimeLabel; #FIXED ""] Time continuously sends the absolute time (since January 1, 1970) for a given simulation tick.
attribute.name: time

attribute.tooltip: [containerField NMTOKEN "children"] containerField is the field-label prefix indicating relationship to parent node. Examples: geometry Box, children Group, proxy Shape. Hint: containerField attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: containerField

attribute.tooltip: [class CDATA #IMPLIED] class is a space-separated list of classes, reserved for use by XML stylesheets. The class attribute is only supported in XML encoding of X3D scenes.
attribute.name: class

element.tooltip: TimeTrigger converts boolean true events to time events.
element.name: TimeTrigger

Warning: each USE value must match a corresponding DEF value that is defined earlier in the scene.
